results.content:
Very high recommend Moodle developer tutorial. You will also learn the background of work flow of Moodle. 
The author is actively visits the content and will answer if you struggle

results.content:
Course was pretty good prepared and everything was very concisely presented.

I want to point out few mistakes that are shown in this tutorial, they are teaching bad practises:
* Placeholders are not beeing used - https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Data_manipulation_API#Placeholders
* the code is repeated many times, the program should be divided into functions
* quite an important thing like adding a plug-in to navigation is not shown
* Never use AS keyword for table aliases. (see https://docs.moodle.org/dev/SQL_coding_style )
* Moodle has pritty rigid coding style, which it is good to stick to. ( see https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Coding_style )

results.content: Really loved it, changed my perspective on the overall workings of moodle
results.content_html: Really loved it, changed my perspective on the overall workings of moodle

results.content: The teacher explains very well, very well commented code, simple and easy to read code, and the most important part "up to date."! I believe this will be a great course for anyone that wants to start with Moodle plugins to learn the basics, before going to another more complex tutorial, that often is not being so well maintainable as this course is and where sometimes there is redundancies and old code that isn't applicable anymore. I highly recommend it!

results.content: Interesting and a lot of useful stuff.  However, got bogged down in a lot of details about the particular example that was chosen for the plugin -- which seemed unnecessarily complex.
results.content_html: Interesting and a lot of useful stuff. However, got bogged down in a lot of details about the particular example that was chosen for the plugin -- which seemed unnecessarily complex.
